data.name: Prime Number Generator :Intermediate (with inputs) version
data.description:
Using ES2015 [Generators](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Generator)
Write a prime number generator.

Just Like in the kata [Prime Number Generator:Simple version](http://www.codewars.com/kata/55bacaaccf8b5eb992000086/train/javascript)

It should return each prime number in order.
It should start with 2 as the first prime number.
Without timing out it should return up the 10,003rd prime.
Unlike the simple version it should also accept input to the [next](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Generator/next) function so that ```javascript primeGen.next(N).value //returns the Nth prime ``` After that it should return consecutive primes starting at N+1.
```javascript primeGen.next(1).value; // returns 2, the 1st prime primeGen.next().value; // returns 3, the 2nd prime primeGen.next(100).value; // returns 541, the 100th prime primeGen.next().value; // returns ???, the 101st prime ``` if N is not a positive integer than it should behave as if it was called without an argument.
